title: Vaccine Administration
description: California Vaccines for Children, VFC Online Immunization Training. Vaccine storage, vaccine handling for California, health care providers.
cleaned_text: Please note that the California COVID-19 Vaccine Program has ended. Some of the content housed on this webpage is no longer being updated and may be out of date. Providers enrolled in the Bridge Access Program (BAP) may access COVID-19 vaccine administration resources on the [BAP Resources Page](https://eziz.org/vfa-317/bap/resources/). California providers may visit [EZIZ.org](http://www.eziz.org) to access COVID-19 and all other routine vaccine information. Vaccine Administration These resources provide operational, clinical, and product-specific guidance from CDPH, CDC, vaccine manufacturers, and more. Find job aids below to help set up the proper protocols in your clinic. Jump to Topic: [Policies and [Vaccination and Planning Vaccine Clinics](#J) [Billing and Reimbursement](#J) Policies and Resources [Vaccine Administration at a Glance](https://eziz.org/assets/docs/COVID19/IMM-1335.pdf)(California COVID-19 Vaccination Program) [Patient Visit Checklist](https://eziz.org/assets/docs/COVID19/IMM-1409.pdf) [Licencees Authorized to Administer Vaccines in Vaccine Guidance](https://www.cms.gov/COVIDvax)(CMS) [COVIDvax Provider Vaccination Staff](https://eziz.org/assets/docs/COVID19/IMM-1429.pdf) [CMA COVID-19 Vaccine Reimbursement Guide](https://www.cmadocs.org/Portals/CMA/files/public/CMA%20COVID-19%20Vaccine%20Reimbursement%20Summary.pdf) General Guidance Website](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/) [COVID-19 Vaccine Planning](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/COVID-19Vaccine.aspx)(CDPH) [Revision of Allocation Guidelines for COVID-19 Vaccine](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/Revision-of-Allocation-Guidelines-for-COVID-19-Vaccine.aspx)(CDPH) Vaccination Program Considerations [Training Modules for Vaccine](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Pfizer-Vaccine-Minor-Consent-Guidance.aspx)(CDC) [VaxText Reminder](https://www.cdc.gov/vaccines/covid-19/reporting/vaxtext/index.html)(CDC) [Report Ancillary Kit Issues to FDA](https://www.accessdata.fda.gov/scripts/medwatch/)| [Consumer Reporting](https://www.fda.gov/safety/reporting-serious-problems-fda/how-consumers-can-report-adverse-event-or-serious-problem-fda) Training for Vaccinators These resources may be used to quickly train vaccinators. Supervisors should provide additional hands-on training and supervision until proficiency is demonstrated. [COVID-19 Vaccination Program Training and Resources (CDPH)](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/Immunization/COVID-19VaccineTraining.aspx#) includes: - Required Trainings for Participation in the CA COVID-19 Vaccination Program - Technical Training for New Vaccinators (IM injections, sites, routes, needles, coadministration, proficiency) - More resources for in-depth
